description: India's 2025 IPO market saw record fundraising but a reality check emerged as many stocks failed to sustain initial hype. While 69 companies listed above issue prices, only 54 remained positive by year-end. Experts advise investors to focus on fundamentals and track post-listing performance, especially for smaller issues, as quality is now being differentiated from mere sentiment.

description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi blamed the BJP for the fatal assault on Tripura student Anjel Chakma in Dehradun, calling it a "horrific hate crime" fueled by "toxic content and irresponsible narratives." Chakma succumbed to injuries sustained in a December 9th assault.

Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera' is pacing steadily, earning Rs. 0.83 crore on its fifth day and reaching a total of over Rs. 24 crore domestically.

title: Hidden health risks of office coffee machines you should know about
description: Your office coffee machine might be a hidden health hazard. Unfiltered brews can elevate cholesterol due to compounds like cafestol and kahweol. Poor hygiene also poses microbial contamination risks. Opt for filtered coffee and ensure machines are regularly cleaned to mitigate these potential cardiovascular and respiratory issues. Stay informed about your daily brew.

World record! Bhutan bowler scripts history; becomes first to do the unthinkable
description: Bhutan's Sonam Yeshey made T20 International history by becoming the first bowler to take an eight-wicket haul, finishing with figures of 8 for 7 against Myanmar. This extraordinary spell dismantled Myanmar's chase, securing an 82-run victory for Bhutan and an unassailable series lead. Yeshey's performance surpasses all previous T20 International records.

The apex court questioned the suspension of his sentence, noting Sengar remains jailed for another conviction. The CBI had appealed the bail, highlighting the horrific nature of the crime against a minor.

description: A driver for the Uttar Pradesh power department was killed when a truck carrying wooden scrap overturned on the Nainital Highway in Rampur. The truck rammed a divider while trying to avoid the Bolero, crushing it completely. The driver, Firasat, was pulled from the wreckage but declared dead at the hospital.

description: A street vendor from West Bengal, Arshad Mallik, was brutally assaulted and accused of being an illegal Bangladeshi migrant in Odisha.  He was rescued by police after a video of the incident went viral.  With assistance from a state minister and local police, Mallik was safely brought back home.

MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
description: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: Indus Waters Treaty put on hold, govt clears another Chenab hydel project
description: India is advancing its hydropower potential on the Chenab River with the approval of the 260 MW Dulhasti State-II project in Jammu & Kashmir. This strategic move, following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, aims to harness the river's untapped capacity. The project, an extension of an existing facility, will contribute to India's hydropower generation goals.

title: Bengaluru businessman held for duping woman of Rs 75 lakh; rapes her minor sister
description: Bagalagunte police arrested Subham Shukla, a 27-year-old textile businessman. He is accused of cheating a woman of gold and cash exceeding Rs 75 lakh. Shukla also allegedly raped her 16-year-old sister. The victims' father filed the complaint. Shukla has been remanded in judicial custody. Investigations are ongoing.

title: ‘AI agents are becoming a problem’: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
description: OpenAI is hiring a high-paid Head of Preparedness amid growing fears of AI systems exploiting security flaws and harming mental well-being. CEO Sam Altman acknowledged models are finding critical vulnerabilities, while also highlighting AI's potential psychological impact. The role will tackle cybersecurity, biosecurity, and self-improving AI risks, a crucial step as AI's dual nature becomes apparent.

title: 'I thought I was the next Steve Jobs': Google founder's 'mindset' lesson for students
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin revealed a key lesson from the Google Glass failure: rushing innovation can be detrimental. He emphasized that students, like his past self, often feel pressured to deliver before readiness, mistaking speed for progress. True success, Brin suggests, lies in allowing ideas and skills adequate time to mature, rather than performing readiness.

title: Travis Kelce: I let Andy Reid down during Chiefs' tough season
description: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.
